title: Order 2020 (S.I. No. 447 of 2020)), 74 (amended by section 7 of the Social
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Social Welfare (Consolidated
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Social Welfare (Consolidated 

Occupational Injuries) (Amendment) (No. 1) Regulations 2021. 

(2) These Regulations and the Social Welfare (Consolidated Occupational 
Injuries) Regulations 2007 to 2020 shall be construed together as one and may 
be cited together as the Social Welfare (Consolidated Occupational Injuries) 
Regulations 2007 to 2021. 

Commencement

2. These Regulations come into operation— 

(a) 

(b) 

in so far as they relate to injury benefit, on 3rd January 2022, and 

in so far as they relate to disablement pension and disablement

title: Order 2020 (S.I. No. 447 of 2020)), 74 (amended by section 7 of the Social
heading: 3. The Social Welfare (Consolidated Occupational Injuries) Regulations
text_raw:
3. The Social Welfare (Consolidated Occupational Injuries) Regulations 

2007 (S.I. No. 102 of 2007) are amended by— 

(a) 

(b) 

the substitution of the Schedule set out in Schedule A to these 
Regulations for Schedule 1 (amended by article 4 the Social 
Welfare (Consolidated Occupational Injuries) (Amendment) (No. 
1) Regulations 2019 (S.I. No 107 of 2019)), and 

the substitution of the Schedules set out in Schedule B to these 
Regulations for Schedule 3 and Schedule 3A (amended by article 
4 of the Social Welfare (Consolidated Occupational Injuries) 
(Amendment) (No. 1) Regulations 2019 (S.I. No. 107 of 2019)), 
subject in respect of the Scales set out in the said Schedule B, to 
the following provisions— 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 31st December, 2021. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [731] 3 

(i) 

(ii) 

the rates of pension specified in column (3) of the Scales 
shall have effect on and from 7th January 2022 whether the 
period taken into account by the assessment began on, 
before, or after that date, and, 

the amounts of gratuity specified in column (2) of the Scales 
shall be payable only where the period taken into account 
by the assessment of the degree of disablement began on or 
after 7th January 2022. 

 
 
 
 4 [731]

title: Order 2020 (S.I. No. 447 of 2020)), 74 (amended by section 7 of the Social
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

The Social Welfare Act 2021 provides for an increase in the maximum rate of 
Injury Benefit payable from 3rd January 2022 and for increases in the rates of 
benefits payable under the Occupational Injuries Benefits Scheme from 7th 
January 2022. Parts 2-3 of Schedule 2 provide for increases to the maximum 
rate of Disablement Gratuity and the weekly rates of Disablement Pension where 
the degree of disablement ranges from 100 per cent to 20 per cent. 

These Regulations provide for increases in the rate of Disablement Gratuity and 
the weekly rates of Disablement Pension where the degree of disablement ranges 
from 1 per cent to 19 per cent. The rates provided for in Schedule 3 apply in 
respect of a continuing disablement of between 1 and 19 per cent which arose 
prior to 1 January 2012. Schedule 3A applies where the disablement occurs after 
1 January 2012 and in such a case, disablement gratuity and gratuity pension are 
payable only where the range of disablement is greater than 14 per cent. 

The Regulations also provide for an increase in the rate of Injury Benefit payable 
to persons under the age of sixteen. If, in such a case, there is what amounts to 
full-time employment, or substantially full-time employment, the rate will 
increase by €5.00 (from €203.00 to €208.00). This is the same rate as the 
maximum rate payable to an adult. In all other cases the rate will increase by 
€2.40 (from €97.10 to €99.50). 

The rate increases, provided for by these Regulations, come into effect on 3rd 
January 2022 in the case of Injury Benefit and on 7th January 2022 in the case 
of Disablement Gratuity and Disablement Pension to coincide with the increases 
in rates provided for by the Social Welfare Act 2021. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 8 [731]
